Events.text: Emperor Nerva is forced by the Praetorian Guard to adopt general Marcus Ulpius Trajanus as his heir and successor.
Events.html: Emperor Nerva is forced by the Praetorian Guard to adopt general Marcus Ulpius Trajanus as his heir and successor.

Events.text: Maxentius is proclaimed Roman emperor.
Events.html: Maxentius is proclaimed Roman emperor.

Events.text: Battle of the Milvian Bridge: Constantine I defeats Maxentius, becoming the sole Roman emperor in the West.
Events.html: Battle of the Milvian Bridge: Constantine I defeats Maxentius, becoming the sole Roman emperor in the West.

Events.text: The Visigoths brutally sack the Suebi's capital of Braga (Portugal), and the town's churches are burnt to the ground.
Events.html: The Visigoths brutally sack the Suebi's capital of Braga (Portugal), and the town's churches are burnt to the ground.

Events.text: Byzantine general Michael Bourtzes seizes one of Antioch's main wall towers, which he defends against repeated attacks for three days until the reinforcements led by the stratopedarches Peter arrive and secure the city for the Byzantines.
Events.html: Byzantine general Michael Bourtzes seizes one of Antioch's main wall towers, which he defends against repeated attacks for three days until the reinforcements led by the stratopedarches Peter arrive and secure the city for the Byzantines.

Events.text: Empress Agnes, acting as regent for her son, brings about the election of bishop Cadalus, the antipope Honorius II.
Events.html: Empress Agnes, acting as regent for her son, brings about the election of bishop Cadalus, the antipope Honorius II.

Events.text: The lower town of Smyrna is captured by Crusaders.
Events.html: The lower town of Smyrna is captured by Crusaders.

Events.text: Beijing is officially designated the capital of the Ming dynasty on the same year that the Forbidden City, the seat of government, is completed.
Events.html: Beijing is officially designated the capital of the Ming dynasty on the same year that the Forbidden City, the seat of government, is completed.

Events.text: Christian I is crowned king of Denmark.
Events.html: Christian I is crowned king of Denmark.

Events.text: Christopher Columbus lands in Cuba on his first voyage to the New World.
Events.html: Christopher Columbus lands in Cuba on his first voyage to the New World.

Events.text: Battle of Yaunis Khan: Turkish forces under the Grand Vizier Sinan Pasha defeat the Mamluks near Gaza.
Events.html: Battle of Yaunis Khan: Turkish forces under the Grand Vizier Sinan Pasha defeat the Mamluks near Gaza.

Events.text: Battle of Amba Sel: Imam Ahmad ibn Ibrahim al-Ghazi again defeats the army of Lebna Dengel, Emperor of Ethiopia. The southern part of Ethiopia falls under Imam Ahmad's control.
Events.html: Battle of Amba Sel: Imam Ahmad ibn Ibrahim al-Ghazi again defeats the army of Lebna Dengel, Emperor of Ethiopia. The southern part of Ethiopia falls under Imam Ahmad's control.

Events.text: The first university in the New World (in present-day Dominican Republic), the Universidad Santo Tomás de Aquino, is established.
Events.html: The first university in the New World (in present-day Dominican Republic), the Universidad Santo Tomás de Aquino, is established.

Events.text: French Wars of Religion: The Siege of La Rochelle, which had lasted for 14 months, ends with the surrender of the Huguenots.
Events.html: French Wars of Religion: The Siege of La Rochelle, which had lasted for 14 months, ends with the surrender of the Huguenots.

Events.text: A vote of the Great and General Court of the Massachusetts Bay Colony establishes the first college in what would become the United States, today known as Harvard University.
Events.html: A vote of the Great and General Court of the Massachusetts Bay Colony establishes the first college in what would become the United States, today known as Harvard University.

Events.text: The Duke of York and Albany's Maritime Regiment of Foot, later to be known as the Royal Marines, is established.
Events.html: The Duke of York and Albany's Maritime Regiment of Foot, later to be known as the Royal Marines, is established.

Events.text: The 1707 Hōei earthquake causes more than 5,000 deaths in Honshu, Shikoku and Kyūshū, Japan
Events.html: The 1707 Hōei earthquake causes more than 5,000 deaths in Honshu, Shikoku and Kyūshū, Japan

Events.text: American Revolutionary War: A British proclamation forbids residents from leaving Boston.
Events.html: American Revolutionary War: A British proclamation forbids residents from leaving Boston.

Events.text: American Revolutionary War: Battle of White Plains: British Army forces arrive at White Plains, attack and capture Chatterton Hill from the Americans.
Events.html: American Revolutionary War: Battle of White Plains: British Army forces arrive at White Plains, attack and capture Chatterton Hill from the Americans.

Events.text: The Pinjarra massacre occurred in the Swan River Colony at present-day Pinjarra, Western Australia. An estimated 30 Noongar people were killed by British colonists.
Events.html: The Pinjarra massacre occurred in the Swan River Colony at present-day Pinjarra, Western Australia. An estimated 30 Noongar people were killed by British colonists.

Events.text: The United Tribes of New Zealand is established with the signature of the Declaration of Independence.
Events.html: The United Tribes of New Zealand is established with the signature of the Declaration of Independence.

links.title: Declaration of the Independence of New Zealand

Events.text: American Civil War: The Battle of Fair Oaks & Darbytown Road (also known as the Second Battle of Fair Oaks) ends: Union forces under General Ulysses S. Grant withdraw from Fair Oaks, Virginia, after failing to breach the Confederate defenses around Richmond, Virginia.
Events.html: American Civil War: The Battle of Fair Oaks & Darbytown Road (also known as the Second Battle of Fair Oaks) ends: Union forces under General Ulysses S. Grant withdraw from Fair Oaks, Virginia, after failing to breach the Confederate defenses around Richmond, Virginia.

links.title: Battle of Fair Oaks & Darbytown Road

Events.text: In New York Harbor, President Grover Cleveland dedicates the Statue of Liberty. The first ticker tape parade takes place in New York City when office workers spontaneously throw ticker tape into the streets as the statue is dedicated.
Events.html: In New York Harbor, President Grover Cleveland dedicates the Statue of Liberty. The first ticker tape parade takes place in New York City when office workers spontaneously throw ticker tape into the streets as the statue is dedicated.

Events.text: The Mino–Owari earthquake, the largest inland earthquake in Japan's history, strikes Gifu Prefecture.
Events.html: The Mino–Owari earthquake, the largest inland earthquake in Japan's history, strikes Gifu Prefecture.

Events.text: Tchaikovsky's Symphony No. 6 in B Minor, Pathétique, receives its première performance in St. Petersburg, only nine days before the composer's death.
Events.html: Tchaikovsky's Symphony No. 6 in B Minor, Pathétique, receives its première performance in St. Petersburg, only nine days before the composer's death.

Events.text: Panama and Uruguay establish diplomatic links.
Events.html: Panama and Uruguay establish diplomatic links.

Events.text: Richard Strauss conducts the first performance of his tone poem Eine Alpensinfonie in Berlin.
Events.html: Richard Strauss conducts the first performance of his tone poem Eine Alpensinfonie in Berlin.

Events.text: World War I: Czechoslovakia declares independence from Austria-Hungary marking the beginning of an independent Czechoslovak state, after 300 years.
Events.html: World War I: Czechoslovakia declares independence from Austria-Hungary marking the beginning of an independent Czechoslovak state, after 300 years.

Events.text: A new Polish government in western Galicia is established, triggering the Polish–Ukrainian War.
Events.html: 1918 – A new Polish government in western Galicia is established, triggering the Polish–Ukrainian War.

Events.text: The U.S. Congress passes the Volstead Act over President Woodrow Wilson's veto, paving the way for Prohibition to begin the following January.
Events.html: The U.S. Congress passes the Volstead Act over President Woodrow Wilson's veto, paving the way for Prohibition to begin the following January.

Events.text: Italian fascists led by Benito Mussolini march on Rome and take over the Italian government.
Events.html: Italian fascists led by Benito Mussolini march on Rome and take over the Italian government.

Events.text: Declaration of the Youth Pledge in Indonesia, the first time Indonesia Raya, now the national anthem, was sung.
Events.html: Declaration of the Youth Pledge in Indonesia, the first time Indonesia Raya, now the national anthem, was sung.

Events.text: Black Monday, a day in the Wall Street Crash of 1929, which also saw major stock market upheaval.
Events.html: Black Monday, a day in the Wall Street Crash of 1929, which also saw major stock market upheaval.

Events.text: World War II: Greece rejects Italy's ultimatum. So, Greco-Italian War began. Italy invades Greece through Albania, marking Greece's entry into World War II.
Events.html: World War II: Greece rejects Italy's ultimatum. So, Greco-Italian War began. Italy invades Greece through Albania, marking Greece's entry into World War II.

Events.text: The Alaska Highway (Alcan Highway) is completed through Canada to Fairbanks, Alaska.
Events.html: The Alaska Highway (Alcan Highway) is completed through Canada to Fairbanks, Alaska.

Events.text: Swiss chemist Paul Müller is awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for his discovery of the insecticidal properties of DDT.
Events.html: Swiss chemist Paul Müller is awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for his discovery of the insecticidal properties of DDT.

links.title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine

Events.text: An Air France Lockheed Constellation crashes in the Azores killing all people on board, including the French former middleweight world champion boxer Marcel Cerdan and French violinist Ginette Neveu
Events.html: An Air France Lockheed Constellation crashes in the Azores killing all people on board, including the French former middleweight world champion boxer Marcel Cerdan and French violinist Ginette Neveu

Events.text: Elvis Presley receives a polio vaccination on national TV. This single event is credited with raising immunization levels in the United States from 0.6% to over 80% in just six months.
Events.html: Elvis Presley receives a polio vaccination on national TV. This single event is credited with raising immunization levels in the United States from 0.6% to over 80% in just six months.

Events.text: John XXIII is elected Pope.
Events.html: John XXIII is elected Pope.

Events.text: End of Cuban Missile Crisis: Soviet Premier Nikita Khrushchev orders the removal of Soviet missiles from Cuba.
Events.html: End of Cuban Missile Crisis: Soviet Premier Nikita Khrushchev orders the removal of Soviet missiles from Cuba.

Events.text: Vietnam War: U.S. officials deny any involvement in bombing North Vietnam.
Events.html: Vietnam War: U.S. officials deny any involvement in bombing North Vietnam.

Events.text: Nostra aetate, the "Declaration on the Relation of the Church with Non-Christian Religions" of the Second Vatican Council, is promulgated by Pope Paul VI; it absolves the Jews of responsibility for the death of Jesus, reversing Innocent III's 760-year-old declaration.
Events.html: Nostra aetate, the "Declaration on the Relation of the Church with Non-Christian Religions" of the Second Vatican Council, is promulgated by Pope Paul VI; it absolves the Jews of responsibility for the death of Jesus, reversing Innocent III's 760-year-old declaration.

Events.text: Britain launches the satellite Prospero into low Earth orbit atop a Black Arrow carrier rocket from Launch Area 5B at Woomera, South Australia, the only British satellite to date launched by a British rocket.
Events.html: Britain launches the satellite Prospero into low Earth orbit atop a Black Arrow carrier rocket from Launch Area 5B at Woomera, South Australia, the only British satellite to date launched by a British rocket.

Events.text: The Spanish Socialist Workers' Party wins elections, leading to the first Socialist government in Spain after death of Franco; Felipe González becomes Prime Minister-elect.
Events.html: The Spanish Socialist Workers' Party wins elections, leading to the first Socialist government in Spain after death of Franco; Felipe González becomes Prime Minister-elect.

Events.text: The Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic holds the first multiparty legislature election in the country's history.
Events.html: The Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic holds the first multiparty legislature election in the country's history.

links.title: Supreme Council of the Republic of Georgia

Events.text: Two hundred eighty-nine people are killed and 265 injured in Baku Metro fire, the deadliest subway disaster.
Events.html: Two hundred eighty-nine people are killed and 265 injured in Baku Metro fire, the deadliest subway disaster.

Events.text: Plame affair: Lewis Libby, Vice-president Dick Cheney's chief of staff, is indicted in the Valerie Plame case. Libby resigns later that day.
Events.html: Plame affair: Lewis Libby, Vice-president Dick Cheney's chief of staff, is indicted in the Valerie Plame case. Libby resigns later that day.

Events.text: The funeral service takes place for those executed at Bykivnia forest, outside Kiev, Ukraine. Eight hundred seventeen Ukrainian civilians (out of some 100,000) executed by Bolsheviks at Bykivnia in 1930s/1940s are reburied.
Events.html: The funeral service takes place for those executed at Bykivnia forest, outside Kiev, Ukraine. Eight hundred seventeen Ukrainian civilians (out of some 100,000) executed by Bolsheviks at Bykivnia in 1930s/1940s are reburied.

Events.text: A group of activists of Bangladesh Awami League attacked a rival political party meeting in Dhaka with oars and sculls and killed 14.
Events.html: 2006 – A group of activists of Bangladesh Awami League attacked a rival political party meeting in Dhaka with oars and sculls and killed 14.

Events.text: Cristina Fernández de Kirchner becomes the first woman elected President of Argentina.
Events.html: Cristina Fernández de Kirchner becomes the first woman elected President of Argentina.

Events.text: The 28 October 2009 Peshawar bombing kills 117 and wounds 213.
Events.html: The 28 October 2009 Peshawar bombing kills 117 and wounds 213.

Events.text: NASA successfully launches the Ares I-X mission, the only rocket launch for its later-cancelled Constellation program.
Events.html: 2009 – NASA successfully launches the Ares I-X mission, the only rocket launch for its later-cancelled Constellation program.

Events.text: Five people are killed and 38 are injured after a car crashes into barriers just outside the Forbidden City in Tiananmen Square, Beijing, China.
Events.html: Five people are killed and 38 are injured after a car crashes into barriers just outside the Forbidden City in Tiananmen Square, Beijing, China.

Events.text: An unmanned Antares rocket carrying NASA's Cygnus CRS Orb-3 resupply mission to the International Space Station explodes seconds after taking off from the Mid-Atlantic Regional Spaceport in Virginia.
Events.html: An unmanned Antares rocket carrying NASA's Cygnus CRS Orb-3 resupply mission to the International Space Station explodes seconds after taking off from the Mid-Atlantic Regional Spaceport in Virginia.
